metadata.synopsis: An Italian engineer (Marcello Mastroianni) makes love in the Alps with a doomed U.S. divorcee (Faye Dunaway).

reviews: One of the best laughs is watching Dunaway working on the subject of despair.
Could Vittorio de Sica possibly have directed it? De Sica, who made The Bicycle Thief? Even a director who had made no movies would have a hard time making one as bad as this.
All is lethargy, inanity, a yawning prettiness.
If it weren't for the gorgeous location shots of the Italian Alps, I would have dozed off.
ith Vittorio De Sica's direction, the eye-pleasing atmosphere of the Italian Alps and Marcello Mastroianni and Faye Dunaway a good team as a pair of ill-starred lovers, there's enough pull.
